data.title: Daniel Tammet
data.meta_description: Daniel Tammet. Writer: The Universe and Me. Daniel Tammet was born on 31 January 1979 in Barking, Essex, England, UK. He is a writer, known for The Universe and Me (2017), 60 Minutes (1968) and Quarks & Co. (1993).
data.text:
He is fluent in at least the following languages: English, German, French, Spanish, Finnish, Lithuanian, Estonian, Icelandic, and Esperanto. In addition, he has created three new languages called MÃ¤nti, Uusisuom, and Lapsi.

Has asperger's syndrome, a form of autism. Also has synaesthesia, which is why he sees numbers as beautiful shapes and colors.

When he learned to count at young age, he would see colors and pictures in his mind. At that time, he assumed that everyone saw numbers as he did.

Is the European and British record holder and number four in the world in remembering the mathematical constant Pi. He used his incredible memory to recite 22,514 decimal places. [14 March 2004]
